column2: Haiti Fails to Honour its Debts

Haitian legacy of debt began shortly after gaining independence from France in 1804. In 1825, France, with warships at the ready, demanded Haiti compensate France for its loss of slaves and its slave colony. In exchange for French recognition of Haiti as a sovereign republic, France demanded payment of 150 million francs. In addition to the payment, France required that Haiti discount its exported goods to them by 50%. In $YEAR$, France agreed to reduce the debt to 90 million francs (500,000Â¤) to be paid over a period of 30 years to compensate former plantation owners who had lost their property. Haiti, however, still refuses to pay what is owed to us and will not do so unless we use force.
We will take what is owed to us.
To safeguard French assets, the Haitian government must be controlled.
Clearly, the Haitians are not fit to rule themselves.
They are not worth our time.

Haitian legacy of debt began shortly after gaining independence from France in 1804. In 1825, France, with warships at the ready, demanded Haiti compensate France for its loss of slaves and its slave colony. In exchange for French recognition of Haiti as a sovereign republic, France demanded payment of 150 million francs. In addition to the payment, France required that Haiti discount its exported goods to them by 50%. In $YEAR$, France agreed to reduce the debt to 90 million francs to be paid over a period of 30 years to compensate former plantation owners who had lost their property. This is the best deal we can get, and refusing to honour our debt will likely result in French intervention.
We must honour our agreements.§R(Pay or owe 500,000¤)§W
We owe nothing to the French.
Haiti has long agreed to paying the french government reparations for their Revolution. It is once again time to demand money from them.
For far to long Haiti has sacrficed it self to the French, now it is over that we have beaten them on the fields of Battle we can enforce that we shall not pay them.
For our entire existance the US has blockaded us for being a slave state it is time for that to stop.
For the Legcay of Toussaint we must reform the Nation
Toussaint Louverture would be dissapointed at the state of Haiti week shall reform the nation to fit his vision of Haiti, Vive la Haiti.
Toussaint Louverture would be now that the reforms are complete we must put them into effect to see Haiti become the light of the new world.
Unite the Mulattoes and Black Haitians
For as long as we existed Haiti have been divided on race now that we have the oportunity it is time to unite the people under a Haitian culture.
Black people across the world have been oppressed by the Europeans since we are the only strong Black state we must liberate them.
Since the days of Toussaint's capture our nation have unofically claimed the Louisiana Territory but now that Haiti is strong we can enforce our claims.
Since the days of Toussaint's capture our nation have unofically claimed the Louisiana Territory but now that Haiti is strong we can enforce our claims.
The peoples of Martinique and Guadeloupe are quite similar in culture to the Haitian people thus it is time to unite with them.
Now that we have the wealth, we can give it to the People yay.
There are revolts in we can take the opportunity to accept many exiles.
Mouvement de Décolonisation et d'Émancipation Sociale
The US Navy sent ships to Haiti 19 times between 1857 and 1913.
Toussaint Louverture led a successful slave revolt and emancipated the slaves in the French colony of Saint-Domingue (Haiti).
When Napoleon's troops arrived in Saint-Domingue, the Haitians adopted a scorched-earth policy.
Haiti will not be enslaved once again
We must peacfully end the the US Blockade on us
Intergrate Our Afro-Latino Population into the General Population

In an agreement in Alexandre Petion, then President of Haiti, and El Liberator, Simon Bolivar, agreed to that Haiti would support Bolivar until all of the Americas are free, but Bolivar would have to end slavery and give equal rights to all slaves in liberated territories, though Bolivar reduced the power of slavery in all countries he freed slavery and discrimination still existed well after Bolivar. But there is always room for change and in our new consistution we have given equal rights to the rest of the population.
Years ago the Andes were controlled by Simon Bolivar and was on the path towards unification before divisions broke it all appart but we now again have the opportunity to reunite
